fields.name: NPROC
fields.desc: number of MPI processors

fields.name: NSTEP
fields.desc: The number of time steps

fields.name: DT
fields.desc: The time increment in seconds

fields.name: SIMULATION_TYPE
fields.desc: forward or adjoint simulation, 1 = forward, 2 = adjoint, 3 = both simultaneously

fields.name: NOISE_TOMOGRAPHY
fields.desc: noise tomography simulation, 0 = earthquake simulation, 1/2/3 = three steps in noise simulation

fields.name: SAVE_FORWARD
fields.desc: save forward wavefield

fields.name: UTM_PROJECTION_ZONE
fields.desc: set up the utm zone, if SUPPRESS_UTM_PROJECTION is false

fields.name: SUPPRESS_UTM_PROJECTION
fields.desc: suppress the utm projection

fields.name: NTSTEP_BETWEEN_OUTPUT_INFO
fields.desc: interval at which we output time step info and max of norm of displacement

fields.name: NGNOD
fields.desc: number of nodes for 2D and 3D shape functions for hexahedral,we use either 8-node mesh elements (bricks) or 27-node elements.If you use our internal mesher, the only option is 8-node bricks (27-node elements are not supported)

fields.name: MODEL
fields.desc: setup the geological models, options are: default (model parameters described by mesh properties), 1d_prem, 1d_socal,1d_cascadia,aniso,external,gll,salton_trough,tomo

fields.name: APPROXIMATE_OCEAN_LOAD
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: TOPOGRAPHY
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: ATTENUATION
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: ANISOTROPY
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: GRAVITY
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: TOMOGRAPHY_PATH
fields.desc: path for external tomographic models files

fields.name: USE_OLSEN_ATTENUATION
fields.desc: use the Olsen attenuation, Q_mu = constant * v_s attenuation rule

fields.name: OLSEN_ATTENUATION_RATIO
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: MIN_ATTENUATION_PERIOD
fields.desc: attenuation period range over which we try to mimic a constant Q factor

fields.name: MAX_ATTENUATION_PERIOD
fields.desc: attenuation period range over which we try to mimic a constant Q factor

fields.name: COMPUTE_FREQ_BAND_AUTOMATIC
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: ATTENUATION_f0_REFERENCE
fields.desc: reference frequency for target velocity values in the velocity model; set here to a typical value for regional seismology / regional models (dominant period of 3 seconds, i.e. frequency of 1/3 Hz)

fields.name: PML_CONDITIONS
fields.desc: C-PML boundary conditions for a regional simulation

fields.name: PML_INSTEAD_OF_FREE_SURFACE
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: f0_FOR_PML
fields.desc: C-PML dominant frequency,see manual

fields.name: STACEY_ABSORBING_CONDITIONS
fields.desc: Stacey absorbing boundary conditions for a regional simulation

fields.name: CREATE_SHAKEMAP
fields.desc: save shakemap files

fields.name: MOVIE_SURFACE
fields.desc: save velocity snapshot files only for surfaces

fields.name: MOVIE_TYPE
fields.desc: Set this flag to 1 to show the top surface only, to 2 to show all external faces of the mesh  in shakemaps and surface movies.

fields.name: MOVIE_VOLUME
fields.desc: save the entire volumetric velocity snapshot files

fields.name: SAVE_DISPLACEMENT
fields.desc: save displacement instead velocity in the snapshot files

fields.name: USE_HIGHRES_FOR_MOVIES
fields.desc: save high resolution snapshot files (all GLL points)

fields.name: NTSTEP_BETWEEN_FRAMES
fields.desc: number of timesteps between 2 consecutive snapshots

fields.name: HDUR_MOVIE
fields.desc: half duration for snapshot files

fields.name: SAVE_MESH_FILES
fields.desc: Set this flag to true to save ParaView mesh files for subsequent viewing.

fields.name: LOCAL_PATH
fields.desc: path to store the local database file on each node

fields.name: SEP_MODEL_DIRECTORY
fields.desc: path to SEP model; if you are using a SEP model (oil-industry format)

fields.name: USE_FORCE_POINT_SOURCE
fields.desc:
use a (tilted) FORCESOLUTION force point source (or several) instead of a CMTSOLUTION moment-tensor source. If this flag is turned on, the FORCESOLUTION file must be edited by precising:
- the corresponding time-shift parameter,
 - the half duration parameter of the source,
 - the coordinates of the source,
 - the magnitude of the force source,
 - the components of a (non-unitary) direction vector for the force source in the E/N/Z_UP basis.
 The direction vector is made unitary internally in the code and thus only its direction matters here 
 its norm is ignored and the norm of the force used is the factor force source times the source time function.

fields.name: USE_RICKER_TIME_FUNCTION
fields.desc: set to true to use a Ricker source time function instead of the source time functions set by default to represent a (tilted) FORCESOLUTION force point source or a CMTSOLUTION moment-tensor source.

fields.name: USE_EXTERNAL_SOURCE_FILE
fields.desc: Use an external source time function. If true then you must add a file with your source time function and the file name path relative to lauching directory at the end of CMTSOLUTION or FORCESOURCE file(with multiple sources, one file per source is required).

fields.name: USE_SOURCE_ENCODING
fields.desc: (for acoustic simulations only) determines source encoding factor +/-1 depending on sign of moment tensor (see e.g. Krebs et al., 2009. Fast full-wavefield seismic inversion using encoded sources, Geophysics, 74 (6), WCC177-WCC188.)

fields.name: PRINT_SOURCE_TIME_FUNCTION
fields.desc: print source time function

fields.name: GPU_MODE
fields.desc: set .true. for GPU support

fields.name: BOTTOM_FREE_SURFACE
fields.desc: set to .true. to make zmin free surface instead of absorbing condition

fields.name: STACEY_INSTEAD_OF_FREE_SURFACE
fields.desc: Stacey absorbing top surface (defined in mesh as 'free_surface_file')

fields.name: USE_LDDRK
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: INCREASE_CFL_FOR_LDDRK
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: RATIO_BY_WHICH_TO_INCREASE_IT
fields.desc: see SPECFEM3D_CARTESIAN manual

fields.name: OUTPUT_ENERGY
fields.desc: to plot energy curves, for instance to monitor how CPML absorbing layers behave; should be turned OFF in most cases because a bit expensive

fields.name: NTSTEP_BETWEEN_OUTPUT_ENERGY
fields.desc: every how many time steps we compute energy (which is a bit expensive to compute)

fields.name: NUMBER_OF_SIMULTANEOUS_RUNS
fields.desc: to run several calculations (several earthquakes) in an embarrassingly-parallel fashion from within the same run; this can be useful when using a very large supercomputer to compute many earthquakes in a catalog, in which case it can be better from a batch job submission point of view to start fewer and much larger jobs, each of them computing several earthquakes in parallel.

fields.name: BROADCAST_SAME_MESH_AND_MODEL
fields.desc: set this option to .true. if the mesh and the model are the same for all simultaneous runs

fields.name: NTSTEP_BETWEEN_OUTPUT_SEISMOS
fields.desc: interval in time steps for writing of seismograms

fields.name: SAVE_SEISMOGRAMS_DISPLACEMENT
fields.desc: save displacement in forward runs

fields.name: SAVE_SEISMOGRAMS_VELOCITY
fields.desc: save velocity in forward runs

fields.name: SAVE_SEISMOGRAMS_ACCELERATION
fields.desc: save acceleration in forward runs

fields.name: SAVE_SEISMOGRAMS_PRESSURE
fields.desc: save pressure in forward runs

fields.name: USE_BINARY_FOR_SEISMOGRAMS
fields.desc: save seismograms in binary or ASCII format (binary is smaller but may not be portable between machines)

fields.name: SU_FORMAT
fields.desc: output seismograms in Seismic Unix format (binary with 240-byte-headers)

fields.name: WRITE_SEISMOGRAMS_BY_MASTER
fields.desc: decide if master process writes all the seismograms or if all processes do it in parallel

fields.name: SAVE_ALL_SEISMOS_IN_ONE_FILE
fields.desc: save all seismograms in one large combined file instead of one file per seismogram

fields.name: USE_TRICK_FOR_BETTER_PRESSURE
fields.desc: use a trick to increase accuracy of pressure seismograms in fluid (acoustic) elements

fields.name: NTSTEP_BETWEEN_READ_ADJSRC
fields.desc: interval in time steps for reading adjoint traces; 0 = read the whole adjoint sources at the same time

fields.name: ANISOTROPIC_KL
fields.desc: this parameter must be set to .true. to compute anisotropic kernels in crust and mantle (related to the 21 Cij in geographical coordinates). Default is false. to compute isotropic kernels (related to alpha and beta)

fields.name: SAVE_TRANSVERSE_KL
fields.desc: compute transverse isotropic kernels (alpha_v,alpha_h,beta_v,beta_h,eta,rho) rather than fully anisotropic kernels in case ANISOTROPIC_KL is set to true.

fields.name: APPROXIMATE_HESS_KL
fields.desc: outputs approximate Hessian for preconditioning

fields.name: SAVE_MOHO_MESH
fields.desc: save Moho mesh and compute Moho boundary kernels
